column1: George Town is a city situated on Grand Cayman in the Cayman Islands. It serves as the capital of the Cayman Islands
column2: in the British West Indies. As of 2019
column3: the city had a population of 40
column4: 200 making it the largest city (by population) of all the British Overseas Territories.George Town is the heart of the Cayman Islands financial services industry (there are close to 600 Bank and Trust companies in the Cayman Islands). The Caymanian government offices are located in the city. According to the Globalization and World Cities Research Network in 2016
column5: George Town is classed as a 'Beta − city'.

column1: The Caymanian government offices are located in George Town. These offices include the Parliament of the Cayman Islands
column2: the Court Houses and the Government Administration Building. The Government Administration Building houses the offices of the Premier and other members of Cabinet
column3: the Deputy Governor and his staff as well as other elected officials and civil servants. The former Old Courts Building located at the corner of Shedden Road and Harbour Drive is now the National Museum of Grand Cayman. The building was built more than 150 years ago and has served the Caymanian government not only as a court building but as a jail and the island's first official Post Office.

column1: George Town is known to be a melting pot of different cultures
column2: with more than 100 nationalities calling the city home. Most of George Town’s residents are expatriates
column3: with Jamaicans being the largest immigrant group to populate the city. Most Caymanians live outside of George Town
column4: in West Bay and the eastern districts.

column1: There is also a large Asian community consisting mainly of Filipinos and Indians
column2: as well as many more nationalities living in and around George Town.

column1: George Town's city limits extend from the east at the edge of the South Shore District
column2: north just beyond Owen Roberts International Airport
column3: south to Hog Sty Bay and west to Seven Mile Beach and the West Bay District. George Town's famous Seven Mile Beach is a long crescent of coral-sand beach extending up to the West Bay region of Grand Cayman and is the most popular and populated area for tourists on the island.

column1: Georgetown has an Am or tropical monsoon climate
column2: with a hot and wet season from May through November
column3: and a warm and dry season from December through April. As with most tropical climates
column4: there is only a slight variation in monthly mean temperatures during the course of the year.

column1: The financial services generated CI$1.2 billion of GDP in 2007 (55% of the total economy)
column2: 36% of all employment and 40% of all government revenue. The Cayman Islands ranks fifth internationally in terms of value of liabilities booked and sixth in terms of assets booked. It has branches of 40 of the world's 50 largest banks. The Cayman Islands are the second largest captive domicile in the world with more than 700 captives
column3: writing more than US$7.7 billion of premiums and with US$36.8 billion of assets under management. There are more than 9
column4: 500 funds under licence with globally recognised legal
column5: audit/accounting and fund administration services (incl. the Big Four auditors). Major law firms such as Maples and Calder have established themselves in the Cayman Islands. Similarly
column6: large accounting firms such as KPMG
column8: Ernst & Young and Deloitte are also present. As a result
column9: the Cayman Islands are a leader in captive domiciles
column10: hedge fund registrations and is considered a major international banking centre.

column1: George Town is a popular port of call for the Caribbean with cruise ships anchoring in George Town Harbour Tuesday through Friday. Cruise ships calling at George Town anchor offshore and ferry their passengers ashore by tenders
column2: also known as shuttle boats. Passengers disembark in George Town
column3: in the centre of the Grand Cayman shopping district and usually remain anchored from early morning until mid-afternoon.

column1: Activities available to tourists in George Town include submarine tours of George Town Harbour
column12: Seven Mile Beach is host to numerous nightclubs and bars. George Town's waterfront is also home to a Harley-Davidson shop
column14: and a Guy Harvey art studio and restaurant. Ritz-Carlton Grand Cayman is the grandest hotel on the island.

column2: as well as the rest of Grand Cayman
column3: is served by nearby Owen Roberts International Airport. It is one of the only two entrance points to the Cayman Islands by air
column4: the other being Charles Kirkconnell Airport on Cayman Brac.

column1: There are over 55 weekly flights into the Cayman Islands. Cayman Airways is the National Flag Carrier of the Cayman Islands and features five Boeing 737 jets and two Twin Otters. Non-stop service to Grand Cayman are available from Atlanta

The Cayman Islands Education Department operates George Town Primary School

column1: John Gray High is in the former George Hicks High School building since 2012.Caymanian children are entitled to free primary and secondary education.
